title: Lauren Van De Hey
text:
Hello,
I am a Ph.D.Â Candidate in the Department of Politics studying American politics at who the University of Virginia. My dissertation research is supervised by Nick Winter, Paul Freedman, Justin H. Kirkland, and Kirill Zhirkov and focuses on the intersection of mental health, political behavior, and social identity. Prior to studying at UVA, I earned a B.A. in political science and a B.S. in General Biology from the University of California, San Diego.
My broader research interests include public opinion, health politics, race and ethnic politics, and research methods.

title: Publications and Projects
text:
Working Projects:

Just a Little Melancholic, Maybe a Little Blue: Mental Health as an Emerging Political Identity

Presented at Annual Midwest Political Science Association Conference 2023

Getting Blogged Down: Tracing Illiberal Political thought Through Blogs Using Text Analysis

Presented at Annual Midwest Political Science Association Conference 2023, to be presented at American Political Science Association Annual Meeting 2023.

Political Trust in the Age of COVID-19: Does Low Institutional Trust Lead to Worse Mental Health?

To be presented at the Political Psychology Pre-Conference to APSA 2023.
